Package presentation

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
presentation.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Class Controller. It adds the functionality of the Model class to the View.

  • Field Details

    • LOGGER

      protected static final Logger LOGGER
      The LOGGER for this class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller(View view, Model model)
      Instantiates a new controller. Adds listeners to the buttons. Sets the table content to the Client table. Shows the view frame.
      Parameters:
      view - the view
      model - the model

  • Method Details

    • createTable

      public DefaultTableModel createTable(List<?> objects)
      Reflection method which creates a TableModel based on a list of objects. It extracts the object's type and fields and sets the names of the column and the data in the rows accordingly.
      Parameters:
      objects - the objects
      Returns:
      the default table model

    • setFiels

      public AbstractModel<?> setFiels(AbstractModel<?> p, DefaultTableModel m, int row)
      It is the inverse of the method 'createTable'. It creates an object from a row in the database using reflection
      Parameters:
      p - the object whose fields need to be modified according to the data presnet in the row
      m - data from the table
      row - the row from which to extract the new fields
      Returns:
      the same object with the updated field values

    • constructModelFromDialogPane

      public AbstractModel<?> constructModelFromDialogPane()
      Construct model object from an input dialog. It uses reflection to set the fields of the object
      Returns:
      the newly created model object

    • constructPaneObject

      public Object[] constructPaneObject(AbstractModel<?> newObject)
      Construct pane panel using reflection. The panel acts as an input for the user to insert a row in a table
      Parameters:
      newObject - the object from which the field names need to be extracted and corresponding JTextFields are created for input
      Returns:
      an array of objects containing the 'model' of the panel which will be used by the method 'constructModelFromDialogPane()' to show a panel to the user for entering the fields for an insertion

    • update

      public void update()
      Iterates through all the modified rows and updates all the corresponding objects. Then it clears the list with the modified rows. It shows a message with the state of the operation.

    • insert

      public void insert()
      Iterates through all the modified rows and inserts all the corresponding objects into the table. Then it clears the list with the modified rows. It shows a message with the state of the operation.

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Iterates through all the modified rows and deletes all the corresponding objects. Then it clears the list with the modified rows. It shows a message with the state of the operation.

    • showSearchOptions

      public void showSearchOptions()
      Show a panel with the search options.

    • showList

      public void showList(int index, String searchFor, int biggerSmaller)
      Show a list of objects which correspond to the search criteria.
      Parameters:
      index - the search filter used(it is the same as the field of the object)
      searchFor - what to search
      biggerSmaller - if it is 2, it will search for values greater if it is 1, it will search for values smaller if it is -1, it will search for equal values

    • objectEqual

      public boolean objectEqual(Object o, int index, String searchFor, int biggerSmaller)
      Checks if the given object corresponds to the search criteria.
      Parameters:
      o - the object which needs to satisfy the search criteria
      index - the index of the filter( the same as the index of the field in the object(reflection))
      searchFor - what to search
      biggerSmaller - if it is 2, it will search for values greater if it is 1, it will search for values smaller if it is -1, it will search for equal values
      Returns:
      true, if successful

    • showTotalOptions

      public void showTotalOptions()
      Show total options.

    • updateTable

      public void updateTable()
      Update table with the corresponding list.
